text: I need some statistics help. I have data of size of instances and running time. Both have ranges in 7 orders of magnitude. They should be linearly dependent which can be seen in a log log plot. Is it reasonable to calculate the r-value from the logs of in- and output or is that cheating? :smile:

elements.text: I need some statistics help. I have data of size of instances and running time. Both have ranges in 7 orders of magnitude. They should be linearly dependent which can be seen in a log log plot. Is it reasonable to calculate the r-value from the logs of in- and output or is that cheating?

text: Why not? That's a power law fit

elements.text: Why not? That's a power law fit

text: I think I just needed some reassurance :wink: thanks

elements.text: I think I just needed some reassurance

text: A lot of stuff looks linear in a log log plot.
